item.title: Elon Musk Completes $44 Billion Deal to Own Twitter
item.description: The world’s richest man closed his blockbuster purchase of the social media service, thrusting Twitter into a new era.
item.dc:creator: Kate Conger and Lauren Hirsch
item.media:description: Elon Musk agreed to buy Twitter for $44 billion in April.

item.title: How Elon Musk Became a Geopolitical Chaos Agent
item.description: The world’s richest man has inserted himself in some of the world’s most combustible conflicts.
item.dc:creator: Cade Metz, Adam Satariano and Chang Che
item.media:description: Elon Musk, center, met the Chinese Premier Li Keqiang in Beijing in 2019. Mr. Musk has been criticized for statements regarding China’s interest in Taiwan.

item.title: The 2022 Race for the House, in Four Districts, and Four Polls
item.description: Swing-district polls by The New York Times and Siena College show how the midterm races are being shaped by larger, surprising forces, beyond the traditional red and blue divide.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher and Nate Cohn

item.title: As Governor’s Race Tightens, a Frantic Call to Action Among Democrats
item.description: Democrats and their allies are pouring millions of dollars into late-stage ads and get-out-the-vote efforts to help Gov. Kathy Hochul as she fends off her Republican challenger, Lee Zeldin.
item.dc:creator: Luis Ferré-Sadurní and Nicholas Fandos
item.media:credit: Kenny Holston for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Joe Biden with Gov. Kathy Hochul at the Micron Pavilion in Syracuse Thursday.

item.title: Zeldin Campaign Investigated Over Charge of Coordinating With Super PACs
item.description: A State Board of Elections investigation was stalled when two Republican board members were absent from a vote to request subpoena power.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Fandos and Dana Rubinstein
item.media:credit: Hilary Swift for The New York Times
item.media:description: New York’s election watchdog is investigating the campaign of Representative Lee Zeldin.

item.title: A Godfather of Chinese Nationalism Has Second Thoughts
item.description: Wang Xiaodong, once called the standard-bearer of Chinese nationalism, now fends off criticisms of being too moderate, even a traitor. “They’ve forgotten,” he said, “I created them.”
item.dc:creator: Vivian Wang
item.media:credit: Gilles Sabrié for The New York Times
item.media:description: Wang Xiaodong in a Beijing bookstore in September.

item.title: Putin Says Russia Is Battling ‘Strange’ Western Elites
item.description: Ahead of U.S. elections, the Russian leader sounded like some right-wing Westerners, saying his fight is not with those in the West who hold “traditional values.”
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski

item.title: For Rishi Sunak, Family Wealth From Outsourcing Adds to a Secretive Fortune
item.description: Britain’s new prime minister married into an $800 million stake in Infosys, a company that does not fit neatly into his party’s views on immigration.
item.dc:creator: Jane Bradley
item.media:description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak of Britain.

item.title: Climate News Can Be Confusing. Here’s How to Make Sense of It.
item.description: Recent headlines describe how war, government policies and other factors are affecting assessments of climate change. Is a chaotic future likely? Is there cause for optimism? Both can be true.
item.dc:creator: Christine Hauser
item.media:description: Wind turbines in front of the lignite-fired Power Plant Niederaussem, operated by German energy giant RWE near Niederaussem, in western Germany.

item.title: Climate Protester Glues His Head to ‘Girl With a Pearl Earring’ Painting
item.description: The artwork by Johannes Vermeer, exhibited in The Hague, was the latest artwork to be targeted by protesters concerned about climate change. One person glued his head to the painting and another glued his hand to the wall.
item.dc:creator: Christine Chung
item.media:credit: Lex Van Lieshout/Agence France-Presse, via Anp/Afp Via Getty Images
item.media:description: Johannes Vermeer’s painting “Girl with a Pearl Earring” joins Vincent van Gogh’s “Sunflowers” and Claude Monet’s “Grainstacks” as paintings targeted by climate activists.

item.title: Memorials for 2 Young Women Killed in Iran Galvanize Protests
item.description: For a second day in a row, tens of thousands of demonstrators protested across Iran against the country’s authoritarian clerical rule. The government response on Thursday was again deadly.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi and Cora Engelbrecht
item.media:description: A video distributed on social media on Wednesday showing people marching toward the cemetery where Mahsa Amini, who died after being detained by Iran’s morality police, is buried.

item.title: The $4,990 Ice Bath
item.description: Cold-plunge enthusiasts are spending big on home tubs and spa classes. Is it worth it?
item.dc:creator: Allie Jones

item.title: Elon Musk Is Buying Twitter. Shudder.
item.description: Rogue billionaires have appeared before, and they will appear again. But this one will control our “digital town square.”
item.dc:creator: David Nasaw

item.title: The Rising Tide of Global Sadness
item.description: The anger and sadness in culture seems to reflect people’s growing disappointment with their lives.
item.dc:creator: David Brooks
item.category: Blind Spot: The Global Rise of Unhappiness and How Leaders Missed It (Book)

item.title: The Republican Double Standard That’s Endangering American Democracy
item.description: Heads, Republicans win. Tails, Democrats cheated.
item.dc:creator: Frank Bruni

item.title: Republicans Have No Inflation Plan
item.description: In fact, G.O.P. policies would make inflation worse.
item.dc:creator: Paul Krugman

item.title: 二十大“霜降”后，如何度过漫长严冬
item.description: 二十大的结果寒意刺骨，而且预示着仍有漫长的严冬在前方。许多中国人的绝望既来自于对社会发展的迷茫，也来自于个人在社交上的孤立。我们该如何保持希望或者做出反抗？
item.dc:creator: Zhan Juan
item.media:description: 周六，胡锦涛在二十大闭幕会上意外离场。他在被人护送出会场外时停下脚步，与习近平交谈。

item.title: No, That Democrat Didn’t Vote ‘100% of the Time’ With Nancy Pelosi
item.description: G.O.P. operatives, like a classic rock station playing “Stairway to Heaven,” believe that the hits work, and so they eagerly link vulnerable Democrats to the “radical San Francisco liberal.”
item.dc:creator: Blake Hounshell
item.media:credit: Gabriela Bhaskar for The New York Times
item.media:description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi last month. By House tradition, the speaker usually does not vote.

item.title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Midnights’: Let’s Discuss
item.description: The blockbuster singer-songwriter’s 10th studio album finds her at a crossroads: Will she continue to reckon with her past, or forge another new path forward?

item.title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
item.description: This weekend our TV critic recommends an informative cooking show, an acclaimed limited series and a bittersweet drama.
item.dc:creator: Margaret Lyons
item.category: When You Least Expect It (TV Program)
item.media:description: Christopher Kimball in a scene from “Milk Street’s Cooking School.”

item.title: Appeals Court Upholds House’s Effort to See Trump’s Tax Returns
item.description: The former president is likely to appeal to the Supreme Court after the full U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit declined to rehear the matter.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage
item.category: House Committee on Ways and Means
item.media:credit: Rebecca Noble for The New York Times
item.media:description: Former President Donald J. Trump may be able to run out the clock on the matter if he appeals to the Supreme Court and Republicans take control of the House before the justices rule.

item.title: US Economy Grew at 2.6% Annual Rate in Q3, GDP Report Shows
item.description: Gross domestic product increased 0.6 percent after two quarters of decline, but key components continue to show an economic slowdown.
item.dc:creator: Ben Casselman

item.title: NASA Finds Mars Meteor Impacts Left Craters and Shook Planet
item.description: Scientists thought the InSight spacecraft had recorded some major marsquakes, but with another NASA mission’s help, they found what had really shaken up the red planet.
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Chang
item.media:description: The white spots are water ice that was kicked up by a meteor impact on Mars last December. The crater is about 500 feet wide.

item.title: 8 People Dead in Oklahoma House Fire, Police Say
item.description: The deaths, in a city near Tulsa, are being investigated as homicide.
item.dc:creator: Vimal Patel
item.media:credit: Ian Maule/Tulsa World, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Police officers and firefighters at a house fire in Broken Arrow, Okla. where eight people were found dead.

item.title: How to Prepare for Daylight Saving Time
item.description: Earlier mornings and shorter evening light can be a tough adjustment. But there are ways to prepare for the end of daylight saving.
item.dc:creator: Holly Burns

item.title: How to Get Back Into Running After a Long Break
item.description: Whether you’re lacing up your running shoes after a few months or a few years, follow these tips to avoid injury and frustration.
item.dc:creator: Knvul Sheikh
item.media:credit: Landon Speers for The New York Times

item.title: The Worst Foods and Drinks for Your Teeth
item.description: When assessing how likely a given meal, snack or drink is to harm your dental health, there are two main things to consider, experts say.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Seo
item.media:credit: Kelsey McClellan for The New York Times

item.title: Is It Covid or the Flu? How to Tell Symptoms Apart
item.description: There are slight differences in symptoms, but the best way to tell which infection you have is through a test.
item.dc:creator: Dani Blum

item.title: How to ‘Romanticize Your Life’
item.description: A trend that took off early in the pandemic encourages people to appreciate life’s simple pleasures, a philosophy that resonates just as strongly two years later.
item.dc:creator: Christina Caron

item.title: This Easy Alfredo Recipe Is Better (and Cheaper) Than Going Out
item.description: This easy, creamy version of the classic fettuccine from Genevieve Ko costs much less than takeout and tastes even better.
item.dc:creator: Genevieve Ko
item.media:credit: Kate Sears for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Hadas Smirnoff.

item.title: How to Solve Hard Crosswords
item.description: Friday, Saturday and Sunday bring some of the hardest puzzles of the week.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Frere and Isaac Aronow
